reviews.text: Just got back from our weekend break and generally a good time was had by all. Having been camping on numerous occasions we thought we would give the camping pods a go as they had been recommended by a friend who works for Hoburne. We found the pods to be fairly comfortable although small but agree with a previous review that they could have done with a bit more storage. The pods probably aren't in the best position being near the playground and in the shade so difficult to find any sun around the pod. We had a great time in the area, which is a lovely part of the country and especially enjoyed riding on the steam train and our dog loved the beach. Unfortunately we didn't get to use the swimming pool as we were too busy, it would have been better if it had stayed open later in the evening, 5.30 is a bit early in the summer holidays. Would certainly recommend to others but not sure if would come with kids again probably better for 2 people.
reviews.title: weekend break in a camping pod

reviews.text: We had been looking for a reasonable weeks holiday at the end of the summer holidays when I found Hoburne holidays. We have stayed with Hoburne before somewhere else but had been impressed then so thought we'd give them a go again. Although quite cheap,£550 for a week, we were pleasantly surprised. Our caravan was exceptional very modern and had an en suit in our bedroom which we weren't expecting. It had lots of kitchen equipment and comfy movable chairs in the living area. Although no entertainment we didn't need it, we love walking so kept us entertained and the beach was only a stones throw. Our caravan was right next to the reception and shop and it didn't bother us at all, no noise. One thing we didn't know before we went was that you cant park by your caravan but the car parks are close by and plenty of them.
reviews.title: Excellent caravan

reviews.text: We chose blue anchor for our family holiday this year for a couple of reasons, 1 we love the whole general area, 2 the location of the site (we all love the beach & trains so being able to see both from our van was just perfect.) All of the staff we encountered were very lovely, polite & helpful. The site is lovely & clean & also quiet which for us is perfect (even though we have children we don't like all the big fuss etc on larger holiday sites) the van we stayed in A32 was lovely & clean & also very cosy & comfy we all slept very well. We loved our holiday so much that we are already planning next years. We didn't use the pool but from what we saw it looked fab, the park was a huge hit with our children (8 years & also 19 months) the kids also loved seeing all the bunnys around the site. We found the beach to be perfect for us & when we wanted to do sandcastles we made sure we took buckets into Minehead. Great holiday site that has lots of lovely places to visit nearby.
reviews.title: superb holiday

reviews.text: A lovely small, friendly site, perfect for families and steam train enthusiasts! The site is well maintained and has a lovely relaxed feel. My little boy LOVES watching the steam trains and it is only a 10 minute walk to the train station. The swimming pool is warm and perfect for children. The big 'mushroom' in the middle which pours out water is great fun. I agree with a previous reviewer that the showers could be improved but this is only a slight negative. The staff are friendly and welcoming. It is the perfect spot for exploring Exmoor, Dunster, Minehead, Lynton and Lynmouth. There's a fab fish and chip van that sometimes parks on the seafront which sells delicious fish and chips too! We love it here and will be back soon.
reviews.title: Fabulous site - my little boy loves it here

reviews.text: The idea of a camping pod is very good how ever this pod was not well designed or comfortable. The sofa bed was not a sofa or a bed it was a thin plastic mattress that folded in half, one step up from sleeping on the floor. Camp beds were hard and felt like sleeping on a concrete slab. There are no storage areas apart from the fridge, nowhere to store clothes, food, cups etc. Be aware if you are with small children that the kettle is on a low shelf and there are steps in and out of pod. The beach is not ideal for children with dangerous rocks and areas of mud. Swimming pool on site was great for our grandchildren and they enjoyed the park.
reviews.title: 1 st time in a pod

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 3 night stay at this park, and in over 15 years of this type of holiday, thought it was one of the best parks we have ever visited, located right on the seafront, clean, tidy, well laid out and on level ground. The park is very quiet, has a well stocked shop and a very nice indoor pool. There is no clubroom, bar or amusements, but we can manage perfectly well without these things.
reviews.title: One of our best short breaks

reviews.text: Our caravan was superb, with large bedroom and king sized bed which was very comfortable, plenty of storage space and decking with table and chairs. Outside the park there are a couple of pubs nearby, and a cafe just a short distance away. The West Somerset Railway with steam trains runs alongside the park, with Blue Anchor station nearby.
reviews.title: such a lovely caravan park

reviews.text: Minehead and Dunster with its castle and grounds are just a short drive away, and a bit furthur down the A39 are Porlock and the stiff climb up to Exmoor, with the village of Lynmouth on the other side. The viewing area with cafe about half way across the moor is certainly worth a stop.
reviews.title: What a great place for a tourer or motor home

reviews.text: Overall, we had a most enjoyable weekend, we will be going back.
reviews.title: A lovely clean and friendly park.

reviews.text: Booked with sun holidays. Then up graded to gold caravan. First impressions that it was clean every where and tidy. Reception staff were very friendly. The caravan was new spotlessly clean and no litter outside. We had a lovely holiday. If you like quietness with no entertainment this is the place to come. It has a very nice swimming pool which we did not use but saw. You walk out of the park to the sea front. We walked from blue anchor to dunster beach which we enjoyed. will be coming back next year
reviews.title: Probably better than B&B
Blue anchor
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay and had a great time. There was lots to do and everyone I went with enjoyed it to.

However, there was a women lifeguard who was completely out of order! At one point there was 8 people in the pool and she didn't allow us to play with our inflatable ball which we brought from your shop. We understand it could of been dangerous if there were lots of people but there wasn't. Following that she continued to shout at people for them just having fun, like I said before I understand she needs to make sure everyone is safe but speaking to people in the way she did and shouting at them, not even giving them a warning, it completely unnecessary. I never saw her smile and she made me and my family feel extremely uncomfortable. An 8 year old nephew in my family wouldn't go near the mushroom because he was scared she would shout at him, I don't understand how thats fair when he's meant to be enjoying his swim on his summer holiday. But other then that disappointing attitude from that one lifeguard I had a brilliant time and so did the rest of my family, thank you.
reviews.title: Quiet and peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This caravan park is situated right on the seafront it has static caravans and also caters to tourers. It has a shower block and toilet block on site although as I stayed in a static caravan I can't comment on how clean they were.
reviews.title: Great setting, peaceful and secluded

reviews.text: It is a very family friendly site although it does not have a club or bar it has a large children's play area and a swimming pool which is fairly shallow - when I went there was no lifeguard in attendance though. There is a lot of wildlife around the site and they have devised a nature trail which is a perfect activity for younger children.
reviews.title: Best site in North Somerset

reviews.text: It is a quiet site but the caravans by the seafront are not as quiet as there is a fair amount of traffic along the road by the coast and as the beach is popular for fishing there were fishermen there day and night whenever the tide was in. Caravans at the back of the site would be better for those who want peace and quiet.
reviews.title: A fabulous relaxing holiday

reviews.text: 1st ever touring holiday booked at the last minute and we all had a great time. Friendly and helpfull staff, clean and well maintained site. Toilet and shower block were clean at all times, would stay there again and recommend to family and friends
reviews.title: Kids could play safely and quiet and relaxing location

reviews.text: Took a short break staying in the new Camping Pods. Can Highly recommend them if you enjoy camping but would like something with a bit more comfort. We usually go camping in a tent, but as we were taking our 5 year old niece with us we decided that the camping pods would be a better choice. The Pods are wooden huts with 2 electric sockets, a fridge and kettle. 2 small camping style beds and a small sofa bed. They are great shelter if it rains (which unfortunately it did on our first day) Having electricity meant that it was easy to charge phones and of course make a cup of coffee in the morning. They were nice and warm in the night and had good sound insulation. They are not situated in the best place being near the play area which did mean that there was a lot of noise from the children playing and our hut did get hit a few times by stray balls. The rest of the site was very peaceful.
reviews.title: Camping with comfort

reviews.text: The toilet block was Clean and functional, and not too far away.
reviews.title: Don't book if you want a child friendly beach.

reviews.text: The swimming pool was great (My Niece said it was the best pool in the world!). Clean and ideal for families. Great changing area with lockers. I especially liked the Jacuzzi style corner of the pool that meant that adults could sit and relax but still have full view of the whole pool to keep their eye on the children.
reviews.title: Would be better with coffee
Good experience for first camping trip
reviews.text: All staff were very friendly and always happy to help.
